properties.name: miscanmod
properties.description: Models above-ground biomass yield for Miscanthus in Europe
properties.comment: The model was developed to provide estimates of above ground biomass yield values for Miscanthus for 0.5ox0.5o grid squares across the whole of Europe. The data for the model came from databases of average monthly radiation, rainfall and temperature. Soil moisture holding capacities were likewise taken from a Europe wide database. The monthly values were disaggregated to daily values by linear interpolation to feed to the model as driving variables. The model was then used on each grid square in turn to calculate the end of growing season yield by stepping the model through time with one day time steps. The yield results were then plotted on a map and used to estimate the potential of the crop in meeting carbon emission reduction targets. For the mapping account was also taken of land not available to Miscanthus cultivation or where the yields were too low to be useful.

nodespecs.comment: Inputs daily incident photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) (MJ/m2 ground/day) from data file and sums it.
nodespecs.name: photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) INPUT

nodespecs.comment: Data file is just a column (no comma at end of line) of daily PAR values in MJ/m2 ground/day. Each data point is one day apart. The first value is for the first day after the start of the simulation and will be used by Simile as the time zero value to make calculations over the first day. Data stored in a table (array). The data file is attached to this variable after building the model using the Run control's File -> Parameter menu commands. <worksheetref name="model" column="G" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Reads incident daily photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) (MJ/m2 ground/day) from data file.
nodespecs.name: input PAR file

nodespecs.comment: Copy of data read from file but fed to this variable as the single value relevant for a given day in the simulation. <worksheetref name="model" column="G" fromrow="24" torow="388" > This variable also replaces column K in the spreadsheet which is a duplicate of column G. </worksheetref>
nodespecs.description: Daily incident photosynthetically active radiation (PAR)(MJ/m2 ground/day)
nodespecs.name: PAR

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="C" row="15" />
nodespecs.description: Sums PAR (MJ/m2 ground)
nodespecs.name: PAR total

nodespecs.comment: Controls water's impact on the model. Inputs the daily rainfall and potential evaporation and uses them to estimate the potential soil moisture deficit (SMDp). The SMDp is then used to produce scaling factors used to affect the plants radiation use efficiency (RUE) and leaf area index (LAI) as needed.
nodespecs.name: water submodel

nodespecs.comment: Reads rainfall data (mm) for each day from file and sums them
nodespecs.name: rainfall INPUT

nodespecs.comment: Copy of data read from file but fed to this variable as the single value relevant for a given day in the simulation. <worksheetref name="model" column="H" fromrow="24" torow="388" > This variable also replaces columns P and U on the spreadsheet as these are copies of column H. </worksheetref>
nodespecs.description: Daily rainfall (mm)
nodespecs.name: rainfall

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="M" row="15" />
nodespecs.description: Sums rainfall (mm)
nodespecs.name: total rainfall

nodespecs.comment: Data file is just a column (no comma at end of line) of daily rainfalls in mm. Each data point is one day apart. The first value is for the first day after the start of the simulation and will be used by Simile as the time zero value to make calculations over the first day. Data stored in a table (array). The data file is attached to this variable after building the model using the Run control's File -> Parameter menu commands. <worksheetref name="model" column="H" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Reads daily rainfalls (mm) from data file
nodespecs.name: input rainfall file

nodespecs.comment: For a data file of values for each of 365 days the first value is used for time 0 which means that the final file value is used at time 364. The file value for time 364 is used to calculate the changes in the state variables over that day to give their "extrapolated" values at time 365. Thus you need to integrate to time 365 to see all the values of the state variables. At time 365 the file has run out of values and Simile uses the previous file value which will cause a running sum to over estimate by that value. Thus the need to trap this with an "if" statement.
nodespecs.description: Test variable which calculates a running sum using prev().
nodespecs.name: alt total rainfall calc
fn101
nodespecs.spec: if time() > 364 then prev(1) else prev(1) + rainfall

nodespecs.comment: Inputs daily potential evaporation (PE) in mm/day from a data file.
nodespecs.name: potential evaporation (PE) INPUT

nodespecs.comment: Data file is just a column (no comma at end of line) of daily potential evaporation (PE) in mm/day calculated using the Penman-Monteith formula. Each data point is one day apart. The first value is for the first day after the start of the simulation and will be used by Simile as the time zero value to make calculations over the first day. Data stored in a table (array). The data file is attached to this variable after building the model using the Run control's File -> Parameter menu commands. <worksheetref name="model" column="O" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Input PE file
nodespecs.name: input PE file

nodespecs.comment: Copy of data read from file but fed to this variable as the single value relevant for a given day in the simulation. <worksheetref name="model" column="O" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Daily potential evaporation (PE) in mm/day
nodespecs.name: PE

nodespecs.comment: Calculates the potential soil moisture deficit (SMDp). Crops need a certain amount of water to be in the soil to grow properly. The amount of water below this level is the soil moisture deficit.
nodespecs.name: potential soil moisture deficit (SMDp)

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="Q" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Calculate day's potential soil moisture deficit (mm)
nodespecs.name: daily deficit
fn3
nodespecs.spec: if (rainfall - PE) > 0 then 0 else rainfall - PE

nodespecs.comment: Note that SMDp is assumed to be zero at time zero. Crops need a certain amount of water to be in the soil to grow properly. The amount of water below this level is the soil moisture deficit and is therefore a measure of the water stress on the plants. Note that if day's rain cancels or exceeds the SMDp then the SMDp is set to zero. <worksheetref name="model" column="R" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Total potential soil moisture deficit (SMDp) in mm
nodespecs.name: SMDp
fn2
nodespecs.spec: if time() < 1 then 0 elseif daily_deficit < 0 then daily_deficit elseif (SMDp + rainfall) < 0 then rainfall else -1 * SMDp

nodespecs.comment: Calculates a scaling factor (0 to 1 inclusive) that down regulates the calculation of yield using the radiation use efficiency (RUE) depending on the potential soil moisture deficit (SMDp), i.e. the degree of water stress.
nodespecs.name: regulation of radiation use efficiency (RUE)

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="I" row="2" />
nodespecs.description: Value used to set RUE stop point
nodespecs.name: soil type

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="I" row="6" />
nodespecs.description: Potential soil moisture deficit (SMDp) (in mm) when radiation use efficiency (RUE) scaling factor becomes zero
nodespecs.name: RUE stop

nodespecs.comment: This down regulation point is set as a proportion of the stop value based on the value of "percent SMC RUE slow" term. <worksheetref name="model" column="H" row="6" />
nodespecs.description: Potential soil moisture deficit (SMDp) (in mm) when the radiation use efficiency (RUE) scaling factor starts to decrease below 1.
nodespecs.name: RUE SMD down reg

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="L" row="11" />
nodespecs.description: Percentage total soil moisture content (SMC) at which radiation use effieciency (RUE) starts to slow.
nodespecs.name: percent SM content RUE slow

nodespecs.comment: This calculation uses a graph with two break-points. The y-axis is the scaling factor (0 to 1 inclusive) and the x-axis is the potential soil moisture deficit (SMDp, in mm. The more negative the value the greater the stress on the plants). Between a SMDp of zero and the value set by "RUE SMD down reg" the RUE is unaffected and the scaling factor is 1. Between this point and the value of SMDp set in "RUE stop" the scaling factor falls linearly to zero as the SMDp becomes more negative (i.e. as the water stress increases). Beyond the SMDp in "RUE stop" the scaling factor is zero. <worksheetref name="model" column="AC" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Calculates the scaling factor (0 to 1 inclusive) that down regulates the calculation of yield using the radiation use efficiency (RUE) depending on the potential soil moisture deficit (SMDp), i.e. the degree of water stress.
nodespecs.name: RUE down reg
fn5
nodespecs.spec: a = abs(RUE_SMD__down_reg)/( abs(RUE_stop) - abs(RUE_SMD__down_reg) ), b = 1 /( abs(RUE_stop) + RUE_SMD__down_reg ), if (SMDp < RUE_stop) then 0 elseif (SMDp < RUE_SMD__down_reg) then 1 + a + b*SMDp else 1

nodespecs.comment: Calculates a scaling factor (0 to 1 inclusive) that down regulates the calculations using the leaf area index (LAI) depending on the potential soil moisture deficit (SMDp), i.e. the degree of water stress.
nodespecs.name: regulation of leaf area index (LAI)

nodespecs.comment: Set as 90% of the equivalent stop value for radiation use efficiency (RUE) (i.e. "RUE stop"). <worksheetref name="model" column="G" row="6" />
nodespecs.description: Potential soil moisture deficit (SMDp) (in mm) when leaf area index (LAI) scaling factor becomes zero.
nodespecs.name: LAI stop

nodespecs.comment: This down regulation point is set as a proportion of the stop value based on the value of "percent SMC LAI slow" term. <worksheetref name="model" column="F" row="6" />
nodespecs.description: Potential soil moisture deficit (SMDp) (in mm) when the leaf area index (LAI) scaling factor starts to decrease below 1.
nodespecs.name: LAI SMD down reg

nodespecs.comment: This calculation uses a graph with two break-points. The y-axis is the scaling factor (0 to 1 inclusive) and the x-axis is the potential soil moisture deficit (SMDp, in mm. The more negative the value the greater the stress on the plants). Between a SMDp of zero and the value set by "LAI SMD down reg" the calculations using the LAI are unaffected and the scaling factor is 1. Between this point and the value of SMDp set in "LAI stop" the scaling factor falls linearly to zero as the SMDp becomes more negative (i.e. as the water stress increases). Beyond the SMDp in "LAI stop" the scaling factor is zero. <worksheetref name="model" column="AB" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Calculates the scaling factor (0 to 1 inclusive) that down regulates the calculations using leaf area index (LAI) depending on the potential soil moisture deficit (SMDp), i.e. the degree of water stress.
nodespecs.name: LER down reg
fn3
nodespecs.spec: a = abs(LAI_SMD__down_reg) / (abs(LAI_stop) - abs(LAI_SMD__down_reg)), b = 1 / (abs(LAI_stop) + LAI_SMD__down_reg), if (SMDp < LAI_stop) then 0 elseif (SMDp < LAI_SMD__down_reg) then 1 + a + b*SMDp else 1

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="K" row="11" />
nodespecs.description: Percentage total soil moisture content (SMC) at which leaf area index (LAI) starts to slow.
nodespecs.name: percent SM content LAI slow

nodespecs.comment: Inputs daily mean temperatures (oC) from a file and estimates min and max values.
nodespecs.name: temperature INPUT

nodespecs.comment: Copy of data read from file but fed to this variable as the single value relevant for a given day in the simulation. <worksheetref name="model" column="F" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Mean daily temperature (oC)
nodespecs.name: mean temperature

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="J" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Minimum daily temperature (oC)
nodespecs.name: min temp

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="I" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Maximum daily temperature (oC)
nodespecs.name: max temp

nodespecs.comment: Data file is just a column (no comma at end of line) of mean daily temperatures in oC. Each data point is one day apart. The first value is for the first day after the start of the simulation and will be used by Simile as the time zero value to make calculations over the first day. Data stored in a table (array). The data file is attached to this variable after building the model using the Run control's File -> Parameter menu commands. <worksheetref name="model" column="F" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Reads mean daily temperatures (oC) from data file.
nodespecs.name: input temperature file

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="G" row="15" />
nodespecs.description: Sums degree days above Tb (oC days)
nodespecs.name: total DD above Tb

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="AG" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Calculate day's degree days above Tb (oC days) contribution
nodespecs.name: normal calc DD
fn3
nodespecs.spec: if (max_temp < DD_Tb) then 0 elseif ((min_temp + max_temp)/2) < DD_Tb then (max_temp - DD_Tb)/4 elseif (min_temp < DD_Tb) then ((max_temp - DD_Tb)/2) - ((DD_Tb - min_temp)/4) else ((min_temp + max_temp)/2) - DD_Tb

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="C" row="6" />
nodespecs.description: Threshold temperature (oC) for degree day calculations
nodespecs.name: DD Tb

nodespecs.comment: Note that this value resets to zero if day is outside the temperature and photoperiod controlled growing season. <worksheetref name="model" column="AH" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Accumulated degree days (DD, in oC days) within the temperature and photoperiod controlled growing season (gs).
nodespecs.name: accum DD in temp and photo gs
fn102
nodespecs.spec: if photoperiod_and__temp_control_of_gs == 0 then normal_calc_DD else -1 * accum_DD_in_temp__and_photo_gs

nodespecs.comment: Taking the maximum allows for the accumulated DD being reset to zero if days fall outside the photoperiod and temperature controlled growing season. <worksheetref name="model" column="H" row="15" />
nodespecs.description: Maximum accumulated degree days (DD in oC days) in photoperiod and temperature controlled growing season (gs).
nodespecs.name: accum gs DD
fn203
nodespecs.spec: current_max = prev(1), if accum_DD_in_temp__and_photo_gs > current_max then accum_DD_in_temp__and_photo_gs else current_max

nodespecs.comment: Controls the plant's growing season (gs) based on temperature, photoperiod and time of anthesis.
nodespecs.name: control of growing season (gs)

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="O" row="15" />
nodespecs.description: radiation position latitude
nodespecs.name: radiation position latitude

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="AQ" row="21" />
nodespecs.description: Intermediate calculation for photoperiod calculation
nodespecs.name: for photoperiod

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="AQ" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Calculate photoperiod given latitude and declination
nodespecs.name: photoperiod
fn3
nodespecs.spec: a = -1 * tan( (for_photoperiod*pi())/180 ), b = tan(declination), 24*( acos(a * b) / pi() )

nodespecs.comment: Switch set to 0 if day part of growing season and 1 if not. <worksheetref name="model" column="AR" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Switch that defines days in the photoperiod controlled growth season.
nodespecs.name: photoperiod control of gs

nodespecs.comment: Data file is just a column (no comma at end of line) of adjusted day numbers. Each data point is one day apart. The first value is for the first day after the start of the simulation and will be used by Simile as the time zero value to make calculations over the first day. Data stored in a table (array). The data file is attached to this variable after building the model using the Run control's File -> Parameter menu commands. <worksheetref name="model" column="AO" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Reads adjusted day number from file.
nodespecs.name: input day adjust file

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="AP" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Calculate declination
nodespecs.name: declination

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="N" row="6" />
nodespecs.description: Photoperiod threshold that allows growth when exceeded
nodespecs.name: growth control start stop

nodespecs.comment: Copy of data read from file but fed to this variable as the single value relevant for a given day in the simulation. <worksheetref name="model" column="AO" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Adjusted day number
nodespecs.name: day adjust

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="L" row="6" />
nodespecs.description: Average daily temperature threshold (oC) that potentially allows growth when equalled or exceeded.
nodespecs.name: growing season threshold

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="M" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Switch set to 0 if day potentially part of growing season and 1 if not.
nodespecs.name: growing days

nodespecs.comment: Switch set to 0 if day part of growing season and 1 if not. <worksheetref name="model" column="L" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Temporary version of column L which acts as the final temperature control of growing season switch.
nodespecs.name: temperature control of gs

nodespecs.comment: Switch set to 0 if day part of growing season and 1 if not. <worksheetref name="model" column="AU" fromrow="24" torow="388" > Column AT on the spreadsheet is just a copy of column L and is replaced by it. </worksheetref>
nodespecs.description: Switch that defines days that are in both the temperature and photoperiod controlled growing seasons.
nodespecs.name: photoperiod and temp control of gs

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="M" row="6" />
nodespecs.description: Degree days (in oC days) accumulated in the temperature and photoperiod controlled growing season that corresponds to max anthesis and therefore the end of the growing season.
nodespecs.name: max anthesis DD

nodespecs.comment: Switch set to 0 if day part of growing season and 1 if not. <worksheetref name="model" column="AS" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Switch that specifies the end of the growing season because the plants have flowered.
nodespecs.name: anthesis control of gs

nodespecs.comment: Switch set to 0 if day part of growing season and 1 if not. <worksheetref name="model" column="AV" fromrow="24" torow="388" > Column AT on the spreadsheet is just a copy of column L and is replaced by it. </worksheetref>
nodespecs.description: Switch specifying the final growing season (gs) including controls exerted by temperature, photoperiod and anthesis.
nodespecs.name: final growing season
fn3
nodespecs.spec: sum_of_control_switches = anthesis_control__of_gs + temperature__control_of_gs + photoperiod__control_of_gs, if sum_of_control_switches == 0 then 0 else 1

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="AD" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Day's degree days (DD, in oC days) scaled back by the effect of any water stress on leaf area index (LAI)
nodespecs.name: LER effective daily DD

nodespecs.comment: Note that the value resets to zero if the day is not in the photoperiod and temperature controlled growing season. <worksheetref name="model" column="AE" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Sums the effective degree days (DD, in oC days) that are in the growing season as controlled by photoperiod and temperature.
nodespecs.name: sum DD for LER
fn3
nodespecs.spec: if photoperiod_and__temp_control_of_gs == 0 then LER_effective__daily_DD else -1 * sum_DD_for_LER

nodespecs.comment: Although leaf area index (LAI) is dimensionless it technically has units of m2 leaf area/m2 of ground. <worksheetref name="model" column="AF" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Leaf area index (LAI, dimensionless) calculated by direct conversion of the sum of the effective degree days (DD) in the temperature and photoperiod controlled growing season.
nodespecs.name: convert LER DD to LAI

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="AJ" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Calculate the percentage of the incident photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) that the canopy will intercept given its current leaf area index (LAI)
nodespecs.name: percent radiation intercepted

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="AK" fromrow="24" torow="388" > Column K is just a copy of column G and is replaced by it. </worksheetref>
nodespecs.description: Quantity of photosynthetically active radiation (PAR, in MJ/m2 ground/day) intercepted by the canopy.
nodespecs.name: light intercepted

nodespecs.comment: The radiation use efficiency (RUE) is scaled-back by the scaling factor that encodes the influence of water stress on RUE. The yield is only calculated if the day is in the temperture and photoperiod controlled growing season as well as in that controlled by anthesis. <worksheetref name="model" column="AL" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Day's yield (in g dry matter/m2 ground/day) .
nodespecs.name: day yield
fn7
nodespecs.spec: if final_growing__season < 1 then light_intercepted * RUE_down_reg * RUE else 0

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="AM" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Total yield in the growing season (g dry matter/m2 ground)
nodespecs.name: yield

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="D" row="6" />
nodespecs.description: Conversion factor (in /(oC days)) to convert effective degree days (DD) to leaf area index (LAI)
nodespecs.name: DD conversion factor

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="E" row="6" />
nodespecs.description: Extinction coefficient K
nodespecs.name: extinction coefficient K

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="B" row="6" />
nodespecs.description: Radiation use efficiency (RUE) in g dry matter/MJ of photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) intercepted.
nodespecs.name: RUE

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="I" row="15" />
nodespecs.description: Maximum leaf area index (LAI, dimensionless)
nodespecs.name: max LAI
fn203
nodespecs.spec: current_max = prev(1), if convert_LER_DD_to_LAI > current_max then convert_LER_DD_to_LAI else current_max

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="E" row="15" />
nodespecs.description: Total photosynthetically active radiation (PAR, in MJ/m2 ground) intercepted by the canopy in the temperature and photoperiod controlled growing season.
nodespecs.name: total light intercepted

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="J" row="15" > This is the max part of J15. </worksheetref>
nodespecs.description: Max accumulated yield in g dry matter/ m2 of ground
nodespecs.name: max yield
fn206
nodespecs.spec: current_max = prev(1), if yield > current_max then yield else current_max

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="J" row="15" > This is the unit conversion part of J15. </worksheetref>
nodespecs.description: Max accumulated yield converted to t dry matter/ hectare.
nodespecs.name: max yield per hectare
totals affected directly by final growing season (gs)

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="K" row="15" > The summation part of the calculation in K15 on the spreadsheet. </worksheetref>
nodespecs.description: Sums the number of days not in the final growing season (gs).
nodespecs.name: number days not in gs

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="K" row="15" > The subtraction part of the calculation in K15 on the spreadsheet. </worksheetref>
nodespecs.description: Number of days out of 365 that were in the final growing season (gs).
nodespecs.name: length gs

nodespecs.comment: Note that this sum resets to zero if a particular day is not in the final growing season. <worksheetref name="model" column="AI" fromrow="24" torow="388" > Column K on the spreadsheet is just a copy of column G and is replaced by it in the calculations. </worksheetref>
nodespecs.description: Sums the photosynthetically active radiation (PAR, in MJ/ m2 ground) in the final growing season (gs).
nodespecs.name: PAR in gs

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="D" row="15" />
nodespecs.description: Maximum accumulated photosynthetically active radiation (PAR, in MJ/m2 ground) in final growing season (gs).
nodespecs.name: PAR gs total
fn109
nodespecs.spec: current_max = prev(1), if PAR_in_gs > current_max then PAR_in_gs else current_max

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="AW" fromrow="24" torow="388" />
nodespecs.description: Set today's contribution to the rainfall total to zero (mm) if today is not part of the final growing season (gs)
nodespecs.name: in gs rain

nodespecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="L" row="15" />
nodespecs.description: Total rainfall (mm) in the final growing season (gs).
nodespecs.name: gs rainfall total

arcspecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="K" row="15" > The summation part of the calculation in K15 on the spreadsheet. </worksheetref>
arcspecs.name: days

arcspecs.comment: <worksheetref name="model" column="AI" fromrow="24" torow="388" > Column K on the spreadsheet is just a copy of column G and is replaced by it in the calculations. </worksheetref>
arcspecs.name: PAR
